sen.j: 観光圏（かんこうけん）は日本の一つの都道府県または複数の都道府県にまたがった地域を観光のためにまとめたもので、日本を観光立国とする実現に向けての整備をし、観光旅客の来訪および長期の滞在を促進するために日本の国土交通省の外局である観光庁に認定された地域。
sen.e: Kanko-ken (sightseeing areas) are areas (each of which is located in one prefecture or multiple prefectures in Japan) organized for tourism and they are designated by the Japan Tourism Agency, an extra-ministerial bureau of Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism of Japan, to develop sightseeing areas for realizing Japan as a tourism nation and promote tourists' visit and long stay.

Kanko-ken (sightseeing areas) are areas (each of which is located in one prefecture or multiple prefectures in Japan), being organized for tourism; they are designated by the Japan Tourism Agency, an extra-ministerial bureau of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism of Japan, to develop sightseeing areas in order to distinguish Japan as a tourism nation and promote tourists' visits and extended stays.

Kanko-ken (sightseeing areas) are areas (each of which is located in one prefecture or multiple prefectures in Japan), being organized for tourism; they are designated by the Japan Tourism Agency, an extra-ministerial bureau of the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism of Japan, to develop sightseeing areas in order to distinguish Japan as a tourism nation and promote tourists' visits and extended stays.

sen.j: ビジット・ジャパン・キャンペーンにも呼応している。
sen.e: Sightseeing areas are also in concert with Visit Japan Campaign.
Sightseeing areas are also in concert with the "Visit Japan" campaign.
Sightseeing areas are also in concert with the "Visit Japan" campaign.

sen.j: 従来の観光地と呼ばれる狭い地域だけが取り組んだ観光振興では目指す目的の達成に限界があるとされ、このことから広域の圏と呼ぶその地域の創意工夫を生かした主体的な取組を総合的かつ一体的に推進するため観光圏と呼ぶものを設定している。
sen.e: The conventional development of tourism addressed only by a narrow region called kanko-chi (tourist site) is said to have limitations on the achievement of objectives and therefore the areas called Kanko-ken (sightseeing areas) are arranged to promote an individual approach exerting the originality and ingenuity of the area referred to as wide area in a comprehensive and integrated manner.

The conventional development of tourism addressed only by a narrow region called kanko-chi (tourist site) is said to pose limitations to the achievement of objectives, and therefore the areas called Kanko-ken (sightseeing areas) are arranged to promote an individual approach exerting the originality and ingenuity of the area referred to as a "wide area" in a comprehensive, integrated manner.

The conventional development of tourism addressed only by a narrow region called kanko-chi (tourist site) is said to pose limitations to the achievement of objectives, and therefore the areas called Kanko-ken are arranged to promote an individual approach exerting the originality and ingenuity of the area referred to as a "wide area" in a comprehensive, integrated manner.

sen.j: 国または政府によって基本方針を策定し、その地域の関係者との協議を行い地方自治体である市町村や都道府県による観光圏の整備計画の作成とそれらの整備事業の実施に必要な事を関係する観光などの事業者とともに行い、その圏の発展を促すことを目指すもの。
sen.e: The aim is that the nation or government formulates the basic policy, has the talks with the people who are involved in the area, works with relevant companies including tourism operators on the things necessary for preparation of the plan for development of sightseeing area by local government such as municipalities or prefectures and implementation of its development project, and promotes the development of that area.

The aim is that the nation or government formulates the basic policy, has talks with the people involved in the area, works with relevant companies (including tourism operators) on the things necessary for preparation of the plan for the development of sightseeing area by the local government such as the municipalities or prefectures and the implementation of its development project, and promotes the development of that area.

The aim is that the nation or government formulates the basic policy, has talks with the people involved in the area, works with relevant companies (including tourism operators) on the things necessary for preparation of the plan for the development of sightseeing area by the local government such as the municipalities or prefectures and the implementation of its development project, and promotes the development of that area.

sen.j: これは「観光圏の整備による観光旅客の来訪及び滞在の促進に関する法律（平成20年5月23日法律第39号）」に基づくものであり、政府の立場からは国土交通省が音頭を取っている。
sen.e: This is based on 'Act on Promotion of Tourists' Visit and Stay through Development of Tourism Areas (Act No. 39 of May 23, 2008)' and Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism takes the initiative from the standpoint of the government.

This is based on 'Act on Promotion of Tourists' Visit and Stay Through Development of Tourism Areas (Act No. 39 of May 23, 2008),' and the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism takes the initiative from the standpoint of the government.

This is based on 'Act on Promotion of Tourists' Visit and Stay Through Development of Tourism Areas (Act No. 39 of May 23, 2008),' and the Ministry of Land, Infrastructure, Transport and Tourism takes the initiative from the standpoint of the government.

sen.j: 観光圏の整備計画とその実施を目指す地域は所管する大臣に申請し認定を受ける。
sen.e: The area aiming to development and implementation of sightseeing area applies to the minister having jurisdiction over the business in question for designation.
The area aiming toward the development and implementation of a sightseeing area applies to the ministry having jurisdiction over the business in question for such a designation.
The area aiming toward the development and implementation of a sightseeing area applies to the ministry having jurisdiction over the business in question for such a designation.

sen.j: 認定されるといくつかの特例が適用され、また場合により交付金も受けられる。
sen.e: Once the area is designated, some exceptions are applied and in some cases a subsidy is also granted.
Once the area is designated, some exceptions are applied and in some cases a subsidy is also granted.
Once the area is designated, some exceptions are applied and in some cases a subsidy is also granted.

sen.j: 2008年10月3日に16地域、2009年4月22日に14地域が認定されている。
sen.e: 16 areas were designated on October 3, 2008 and 14 areas on April 22, 2009.
Sixteen areas were designated on October 3, 2008, and 14 areas on April 22, 2009.
Sixteen areas were designated on October 3, 2008, and 14 areas on April 22, 2009.

sen.j: 観光圏整備実施計画が認定されると、事業に対して以下のような支援がある。
sen.e: Once the plan for development of sightseeing area is approved, the following supports are provided for the project.
Once the plan for the development of a sightseeing area is approved, the following means of support are provided for the project:
Once the plan for the development of a sightseeing area is approved, the following means of support are provided for the project:

sen.j: 観光旅客の来訪・滞在の促進に効果や成果の見込まれる事業に係る補助金の交付（補助率上限４０％）
sen.e: Subsidization pertaining to projects which are expected to be effective or fruitful to promote tourists' visit and stay (up to 40% of subsidy rate)
Subsidization pertaining to projects that are expected to be effective or fruitful in promoting tourists' visit and stays (up to 40% of subsidy rate)
Subsidization pertaining to projects that are expected to be effective or fruitful in promoting tourists' visit and stays (up to 40% of subsidy rate)
